lead_paragraph: Shareholders suffer when generous stock grants dilute the value of their stakes, and then again when companies buy back stock to counter that dilution.

headline.print_headline: Stung Twice by Lavish Pay at the Top
headline.main: Investors Get Stung Twice by Executives’ Lavish Pay Packages

snippet: Shareholders suffer when generous stock grants dilute the value of their stakes, and then again when companies buy back stock to counter that dilution....
abstract: Gretchen Morgenson Fair Game column describes how mutual fund money managers fail investors by continuing to approve stratospheric executive compensation, even though packages are shareholder expense; notes Wintergreen Advisers study explaining how stock award compensation stings investors twice.
